title: Made In Chelsea: Love Island's Zara McDermott suffers an awkward debut
text:
She’s better known for her exploits on the fourth series of Love Island, but Zara McDermott will add another string to her bow when she makes her Made in Chelsea debut on Monday evening.

In a first look at her entrance on the E4 show, Zara is awkwardly introduced by boyfriend Sam Thompson after he crosses paths with ex-girlfriend Sophie Habboo and co-star Miles Nazaire in a west London bar.

But any potential for confrontation with Sophie, who abruptly dumped Sam before embarking on new relationship with best friend Jamie Laing, is quickly soothed by Zara, with Miles asking her where they met.

Here she comes: She’s better known for her exploits on the fourth series of Love Island, but Zara McDermott will add another string to her bow when she makes her Made in Chelsea debut on Monday evening

‘So we actually me that an event about a year and a half ago,’ she explained. 'He was a bit intoxicated at the time, and doesn't remember it.'

'She immediately saw me and thought, "that guy, I wanna marry!"' Sam added. 'And then before I knew it, bam! Boyfriend and girlfriend, and I couldn't be happier.'

While Sophie maintains an appropriate silence, Miles acknowledges the chemistry between Sam and his new girlfriend.

Face to face: In a first look at her entrance on the E4 show, Zara is awkwardly introduced by boyfriend Sam Thompson after he crosses paths with ex-girlfriend Sophie Habboo and co-star Miles Nazaire

'I can actually see it,' he said. 'He always smiles. Every time he talks about you he's so happy.'

While the extent of Zara's involvement is still to be determined, it's understood that, at present, she is only set to appear in one episode.

No so Sam, who is back to face best friend Jamie Laing and ex Sophie, who got together at the end of season 17.

Cameo: While the extent of Zara's involvement is still to be determined, it's understood that, at present, she is only set to appear in one episode

Calming influence: Any potential for confrontation with Sophie, who abruptly dumped Sam before embarking on new relationship with best friend Jamie Laing, is soothed by Zara in the new clip

While Sam wasn't around to see it, both Jamie and Habbs were seen worrying about what he'd make of the matter.

A source revealed to The Sun in May: 'Sam has been left devastated by Jamie’s actions. They’ve been close friends for years and Jamie knows how heartbroken Sam was when Habbs finished with him.'

Zara and Sam, on the other hand, are going from strength-to-strength it would seem, telling MailOnline last month that they are 'in love'.

Opening up: ‘So we actually me that an event about a year and a half ago,’ she explained. 'He was a bit intoxicated at the time, and doesn't remember it'

The ex: Sophie's first meeting with Sam goes off without incident during Monday's show

They also reiterated that they first met nearly two years ago, before the brunette bombshell appeared on Love Island.

Talking about how they first met, Zara revealed: 'We met a year-and-a-half ago at an event before I was on Love Island. He doesn't remember as he was drunk! We got speaking on Instagram three to four months ago and here we are.'

To which Sam elaborated: 'I was in the Dominican Republic, minding my own business, when Zara replied to an Instagram story... Zara slid into my DMs.

'It was great as then I had the courage to ask her out on a date, we went on our first date about three months ago now. Since the moment she slid into my DMs, we haven't not spoke every day.'
